solution: Point A is traveling along the circumference of a circle with a diameter of 6 inches. This circumference is $6\pi$ inches.  Point B is traveling along the circumference of a circle with a diameter of 12 inches. This circumference is $12\pi$ inches. Both points travel 45 degrees, which is $45 \div 360 = 1/8$ of the circles' circumferences. The difference is then $(1/8)(12\pi) - (1/8)(6\pi) = (1/8)(12\pi - 6\pi) = (1/8)(6\pi) = \boxed{\frac{3}{4}\pi\text{ inches}}$.
